title: Experimental Demonstration and Discussion-Based Learning for Understanding Electric Circuit Concepts

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced studies and experience in executing high-level projects
context.additional_context: Collaborative and real-time feedback-enabled environment utilizing learner-owned devices (BYOD)

learning_goals: Learners can accurately identify 80% or more of core electrical circuit phenomena (current, voltage, resistance changes) by observing experimental demonstrations
Learners can appropriately apply scientific principles (such as Kirchhoff's Laws) to explain complex electrical circuit phenomena in 70% or more of discussion activities
Learners can logically structure electrical circuit problem-solving strategies based on prior lecture content in 85% or more of individual assignments

resources: Basic Electricity Experiment Kit (Diodes, Resistors, Light Bulbs, Multimeter, etc.)
Large-Screen Projector and Experimental Demonstration Equipment
Digital Collaboration Tools (Google Jamboard, Padlet, etc.)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
